content: In Nevada, looking at Gold Bar, our cash costs were $1,712 ounce and all-in sustaining at $2,049 an ounce, although these figures are down slightly from the first half of the year, they remain elevated compared to the prior year due to low production levels resulting from carbonaceous ore issues and are well above spot gold prices. Finally, looking at our 49% cone San Jose mine in Argentina, they generally had a good quarter with cash costs of $1,223 per ounce and all-in sustaining costs of $1,562 an ounce, which a significant improvement from the first half of the year where they experienced COVID related production issues as well as  the San Jose mind during the quarter. We produced 9,000 gold equivalent ounces in the quarter, but what we need to do is increase the rate in the processing plant so that we can decrease the amount of stockpiled or the mine itself is in a very sweet spot of the mining life where any mines find themselves from time to time and where we can produce more or then we can in fact process at this time.
